title: Oh Jang-eun
text:
Oh Jang-Eun (; born 24 July 1985) is a <a href="association%20football">football</a> player from <a href="South%20Korea">South Korea</a>. He was selected to play for <a href="2007%20AFC%20Asian%20Cup">Asian Cup 2007</a>, replacing <a href="Kim%20Nam-Il">Kim Nam-Il</a> after his injury.
Club career.
In 2002, Oh Jang-Eun debuted for Japanese <a href="J1%20League">J1 League</a> side <a href="FC%20Tokyo">FC Tokyo</a>, and set the record for the youngest player to play in the J1 League. Unusually for a Korean, he spent time in the junior ranks of FC Tokyo, rather than having a youth career with a Korean University side. He moved to <a href="South%20Korea">South Korea</a>n <a href="K-League">K-League</a> side <a href="Daegu%20FC">Daegu FC</a>, where he would spend two seasons. He then moved to <a href="Ulsan%20Hyundai%20Horang-i">Ulsan Hyundai Horang-i</a> in 2007, and contributed to the club's win in the <a href="K-League%20Cup%202007">2007 K-League Cup</a>. He made a professional career first <a href="Hat-trick%23Association%20football">hat-trick</a> in an away match against <a href="Jeonbuk%20Hyundai%20Motors">Jeonbuk Hyundai Motors</a> on 23 September 2006.
On 1 February 2011, Oh Jang-Eun signed for <a href="Suwon%20Samsung%20Bluewings">Suwon Samsung Bluewings</a>.
International career.
Oh has been a member of the national side, both at junior and senior level. He played in the <a href="South%20Korea%20national%20under-20%20football%20team">U-20 side</a> in the <a href="2005%20FIFA%20World%20Youth%20Championship">2005 FIFA World Youth Championship</a>. A part-timer in the <a href="South%20Korea%20national%20football%20team">senior side</a> since making his senior debut against Ghana in 2006, the most recent of his 14 caps was against Japan, during the <a href="2010%20East%20Asian%20Football%20Championship">2010 East Asian Football Championship</a>.
Honours.
Club.
<a href="FC%20Tokyo">FC Tokyo</a>
<a href="Ulsan%20Hyundai%20Horang-i">Ulsan Hyundai Horang-i</a>
